data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone always faces forward like this, they will always go forward with every step they take, they will always take 8 steps backwards each time, and in the same way that they got 9 steps left. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After doing 4 steps, you are now ready to turn around. So, the answer is yes.

If the instructions were followed correctly you will take 4 steps to return to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.

Walking backwards makes the entire number of steps increase. So, the answer is No.

It takes 10 steps to return to the starting point. You then take 9 steps to the left. It's a repeat of the first step. So, the answer is Yes.

Just because you turned around 7 times does not mean you return to the start point. So, the answer is no.

Take 6 steps backwards. Then take 8 steps backwards. Then take 2 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Steps that are made to go forward are 4 steps, 6 steps, and 1 step left. So the answer is Yes.

Using the instructions in the first set gives you a number of steps that can be used to return to the starting point. If you take 9 steps by following the first set, you have took 9 steps. Turning around gives you 2 steps and there are 2 ways to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

The same instruction would ask one to face forward for one step backward. the last instruction would ask one to take one step backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward you would still be on the right side. If you always face forward and take 5 steps forward you would still be on the left. In order for you to return to the starting point, you must face one of the directions for each individual piece. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you are automatically going back in time. If you take 6 steps left, you are always going forward. If you take 9 steps left and take ten steps left, you are always going back in time. So, the answer is yes.

It’ s not possible for us to change locations with the same direction. The directions would be different if you were to take 4 steps left or 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps right. If you always face forward, you would always take out 1 step forward. Take 6 steps left. If you always face forward, you would always take that step backward. If you always face forward, you would always always take that step forward. So, the answer is No.
